com.googlecode.aluminumproject.parsers.aluscript

Class AluScriptContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.parsers.aluscript.AluScriptContext

  • public class AluScriptContext
extends Object
    The context that is used by the AluScript parser. Per parsed template, one context will be used.

    The context contains a number of instructions. These instructions can access the getConfiguration(), add and retrieve library URL abbreviations, retrieve the current line number, and add template elements.

    The library URL abbreviations are specific to a nesting level. The nesting level is controlled by the parser, although it is incremented when an action element is added.

                String templateName,
                AluScriptSettings settings,
                List<Instruction> instructions)
                 throws AluminumException
        Creates an AluScript context.
        Parameters:
        configuration - the configuration of the parser
        templateName - the name of the template that is being parsed
        settings - the template settings
        instructions - all available instructions
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the instructions contain duplicates

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(int level)
              throws AluminumException
        Sets the current nesting level. It should not exceed the current nesting level with more than one.
        Parameters:
        level - the nesting level to use
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when the given nesting level is too deep

      • addLibraryUrlAbbreviation

                             String libraryUrl)
                               throws AluminumException
        Adds a library URL abbreviation that can be used by template elements at the current nesting level.
        Parameters:
        abbreviation - the abbreviation of the library URL to add
